content: I don't have personal preferences or feelings. however, i can tell you that each character in death of a salesman is complex and plays an important role in exploring the play's themes. willy loman is the central character and his struggles with the american dream, reality, and betrayal drive the plot. his sons, biff and happy, also play significant roles, representing different responses to their father's failings and the pressure to conform to societal expectations. additionally, linda, willy's wife, offers insight into the toll that willy's failures and disillusionment take on her and her relationships with her family. all of these characters work together to create a powerful exploration of the human condition.
